description: From French cavin (same meaning), ultimately from Latin cavus.

entries.meaning: (military) A hollow route, adapted to cover troops and facilitate their approach to a place.

description: cav(eola) +‎ -in. Coined in J. Vinten et al. (2005),  “Identification of a major protein on the cytosolic face of caveolae”, in Biochimica et Biophysica Acta - Biomembranes, volume 1717, issue 1, pages 34-40:

entries.meaning: (biochemistry) A type of protein that is involved in forming the caveola of many vertebrate cells.
